Uses of Interface
org.jgrapes.core.Channel

  • Packages that use Channel 
    Package Description
    org.jgrapes.core
    This package defines the interfaces and classes that provide the core functionality of JGrapes.
    org.jgrapes.core.annotation  
    org.jgrapes.core.internal  
    org.jgrapes.http

    • Uses of Channel in org.jgrapes.core

      Subinterfaces of Channel in org.jgrapes.core 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      interface  DefaultChannel
      An interface that can be used to specify the component's channel (see Component.getChannel()) as channel in handler annotations.
      interface  Self
      An interface that can be used to specify the object itself as channel in handler annotations.
      Classes in org.jgrapes.core that implement Channel 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  ClassChannel
      The root base class for channels that use their class (type) as key for matching channels with handlers.
      class  Component
      A base class for components.
      class  HandlingErrorPrinter 
      class  NamedChannel
      A class for channels identified by a name (string).
      Fields in org.jgrapes.core declared as Channel 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static Channel Channel.BROADCAST
      A special channel that can be used to send events to all components.
      static Channel Channel.SELF
      A special channel object that can be passed to the constructor of Component.Component(Channel).
      Methods in org.jgrapes.core that return Channel 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Channel Manager.getChannel()
      Returns the channel of the component managed by this manager.
      Channel Component.getChannel()
      Returns the channel associated with the component.
      Methods in org.jgrapes.core with parameters of type Channel 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      <T> Event<T> Manager.fire(Event<T> event, Channel... channels)
      Fires the given event on the given channel.
      <T extends Event<?>>
      T      		 EventPipeline.fire(T event, Channel... channels)
      Add an event to be sent to components listening for such events on the given channels to the end of the queue.
